Perks

View source
  • View history
  • Talk (38)

Perks are a type of Unlockable and a core Game Mechanic in Dead by Daylight.

There are currently 243 Perks featured in Dead by Daylight.


Contents

  • 1 Overview
  • 2 Use
    • 2.1 Perk Slots
  • 3 Unlocking
  • 4 Perk Tiers

  • 9 Trivia

Overview

For additional information on a specific Perk, its history and changes over time, its interaction(s) with Game Mechanics, other Unlockables, or even other Characters, please refer to a Perk's individual Wiki page.

Perks are an essential Game Mechanic in Dead by Daylight and a type of Unlockable that is tied to the Bloodweb.


GameSpot Expert Reviews
Dead By Daylight Review (2020) – Toying With Terror

16 August 2020

Dead by Daylight Review

03 July 2016

Advertisement

Use

When equipped in one of up to 4 Perk Slots in their Load-Out, Perks provide the Character with special abilities in a Trial.

Perk Slots

A Character can be equipped with up to 4 Perks at once, given that all Perk Slots are unlocked, which depends on their Level.

All Characters start off with just one Perk Slot unlocked and will unlock Perk Slots 2, 3, 4 by progressing them to Levels 5, 10, 15.


Unlocking

Like all Unlockables, Perks spawn randomly in the Bloodweb and can be purchased from that with Bloodpoints.

The only exception to this are the Tier I version of the 3 Unique Perks each Character comes with, those are unlocked from the start and available in their Load-Out.


Perk Tiers

Each Perk comes in 3 versions that slightly differ from each other.

These version are referred to as Perk Tiers.
In general, the higher a Perk's Tier, the stronger its effect.

The current Tier of a Perk is indicated by markings (referred to as "Pips") at the top-right side on their icon and also by a Perk's rarity:

  • Tier I: 1 Pip, Uncommon Rarity
  • Tier II: 2 Pips, Rare Rarity
  • Tier III: 3 Pips, Very Rare Rarity

Purchasing a higher-tiered version of a Perk from the Bloodweb will automatically replace the lower-tiered version in a Character's inventory.


Perk Types

General Perks

General Perks are Dead by Daylight's default Perks. There are currently 36 General Perks.

General Perks randomly spawn in the Bloodweb of all Characters and are available to all Players from the very beginning.

Please refer to the Sub-Article in order to all General Perks that are currently available in Dead by Daylight:

  • Perks/General Perks

Unique Perks

In addition to the aforementioned General Perks, each Character has 3 Unique Perks that, as the name implies, initially spawn in their own Bloodweb only and not in that of other Characters.

Each Character already owns the Tier I of their Unique Perks and can immediately select them in their Load-Out.
Additionally, they can find the Tier II and subsequently the Tier III version of those Perks at random in their Bloodweb.

Please refer to the Sub-Article in order to view all Unique Perks, and their associated Characters, that are currently available in Dead by Daylight:

  • Perks/Unique Perks

Unlocking the Unique Perks

In order for other Characters to gain access to the Unique Perks of others, those Perks must first be unlocked through prestiging the original Character:

  • Prestige 1
    • Adds the Tier I version of a Character's Unique Perks to the inventories of all other Survivors or Killers.
    • Unlocks the ability for the higher-tiered versions to spawn randomly in the Bloodwebs of all other Survivors or Killers.
  • Prestige 2
    • Adds the Tier II version of a Character's Unique Perks to the inventories of all other Survivors or Killers.
  • Prestige 3
    • Adds the Tier III version of a Character's Unique Perks to the inventories of all other Survivors or Killers.

Alternatively, a Character's Unique Perks can also be bought from the Shrine of Secrets for Iridescent Shards and thus be unlocked that way.

It should be noted that once the Unique Perks have been unlocked, they will act like General Perks and become completely independent of the original Character they belonged to.
Contrary to the popular belief amongst many new Players, one does not have to obtain Tier II of say Self-Care on Claudette Morel, before that same Tier can appear in the Bloodweb of say Dwight Fairfield.

It should also be noted that if Character A's current Bloodweb contains Tier III of a Unique Perk of Character B, who has not reached Prestige 3 yet, prestiging Character B to Prestige 3 will automatically replace the Perk in Character A's Bloodweb with another random Perk in its stead.
The same applies to Character A's Bloodweb containing the Perk at Tier II and Character B being prestiged to Prestige 2.
However, should Character A not have any other Perks left to obtain from the Bloodweb, a completely new Bloodweb will be regenerated instead.

Boon Perks

Main Article: Boon Perks

Boon Perks are unique to Survivors.

Boon Perks allow Survivors to bless a Totem and imbue it with extraordinary powers that benefit all Survivors within its activation radius.

Hex Perks

Main Article: Hex Perks

Hex Perks are unique to Killers.

Hex Perks curse a Totem and imbue it with debilitating powers that cause Survivors to suffer from negative effects.

Obsession Perks

Main Article: Obsession Perks

Obsession Perks are available to both Killers and Survivors.

Obsession Perks unlock special effects when the Killer and the Survivor they are obsessed with interact with one another, or avoid interaction on purpose.

Scourge Hook Perks

Main Article: Scourge Hook Perks

Scourge Hook Perks are unique to Killers.

Scourge Hook Perks imbue a given number of Hooks with debilitating powers that affect the Survivors that are hooked onto them with negative effects.

Teamwork Perks

Main Article: Teamwork Perks

Teamwork Perks are unique to Survivors.

Teamwork Perks provide two Survivors with special benefits while they remain physically close to one another after completing a Healing action.


All Perks

Survivor Perks (131)

Icon Name Description Character
Ace in the Hole

Lady Luck always seems to be throwing something good your way.

When retrieving an Item<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> from a Chest<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, there is a chance an [[Add-on]]<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> will be attached to it.
* '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">100 %</span>''' chance for an Add-on of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">Very Rare</span>''' Rarity or lower.
* '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">10</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">25</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">50</span>''' '''&#37;''' chance for a second Add-on of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">Uncommon</span>''' Rarity or lower.
<p>''Ace in the Hole'' allows you to keep any Add-ons your Item has equipped upon escaping.

Lady Luck always seems to be throwing something good your way.

When retrieving an Item from a Chest, there is a chance an Add-on will be attached to it.

  • 100 % chance for an Add-on of Very Rare Rarity or lower.
  • 10/25/50 % chance for a second Add-on of Uncommon Rarity or lower.

Ace in the Hole allows you to keep any Add-ons your Item has equipped upon escaping.

"Everything that glitters isn't gold. But gold isn't worth a damn in this place, so this should come in handy." — Ace Visconti

 Ace
Adrenaline

You are fuelled by unexpecting energy when on the verge of escape.
* Once the Exit Gates<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are powered, '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">instantly heal one</span>''' Health State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> and sprint at '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">150 %</span>''' of your normal Running Movement speed for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">5 seconds</span>'''.
* ''Adrenaline'' is on hold if you are disabled at the moment it triggers and will instead activate upon being freed.
* If playing against The Nightmare<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Adrenaline'' will wake you from the Dream World upon activation.
<p>''Adrenaline'' ignores an existing '''''Exhaustion''''' timer, but causes the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.

You are fuelled by unexpecting energy when on the verge of escape.
  • Once the Exit Gates are powered, instantly heal one Health State and sprint at 150 % of your normal Running Movement speed for 5 seconds.
  • Adrenaline is on hold if you are disabled at the moment it triggers and will instead activate upon being freed.
  • If playing against The Nightmare, Adrenaline will wake you from the Dream World upon activation.

Adrenaline ignores an existing Exhaustion timer, but causes the Exhausted Status Effect for 60/50/40 seconds.

 Meg
Aftercare

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability.

You see the Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of the last '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">1</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">2</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">3</span>''' '''Survivor(s)''':
* You have rescued from a Hook<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, or who have rescued you from a Hook.
* You have completed a Healing action on, or who have completed a Healing action on you.
* They also see your Aura.
<p>All effects of ''Aftercare'' are reset upon being hooked by the Killer<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability.

You see the Aura of the last 1/2/3 Survivor(s):

  • You have rescued from a Hook, or who have rescued you from a Hook.
  • You have completed a Healing action on, or who have completed a Healing action on you.
  • They also see your Aura.

All effects of Aftercare are reset upon being hooked by the Killer.
"A Mercy that Rips the Storm.
Oil work to honour my best buddies who happen to be the best musicians I know. Their first album is still my favourite. It got me through a dark time in my life." — Jeff, oil on canvas, 16x16

 Jeff
Alert

Your acute senses are on high alert.

Whenever the Killer destroys a Pallet<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> or a Breakable Wall<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, or damages a Generator<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, their Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> is revealed to you for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">4</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">5</span>''' '''seconds'''.

Your acute senses are on high alert.

Whenever the Killer destroys a Pallet or a Breakable Wall, or damages a Generator, their Aura is revealed to you for 3/4/5 seconds.

"I have true sight," — Feng Min
 Feng
Any Means Necessary

You stand up for yourself, using whatever's on hand to gain an advantage.
<p>Press and hold the ''Active Ability button'' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">5</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">4</span>''' '''seconds''' while standing beside a dropped Pallet to reset it to its upright position.
*Grants the ability to see the Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of all dropped but not yet destroyed Pallets<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> in the environment.

You stand up for yourself, using whatever's on hand to gain an advantage.

Press and hold the Active Ability button for 6/5/4 seconds while standing beside a dropped Pallet to reset it to its upright position.

  • Grants the ability to see the Auras of all dropped but not yet destroyed Pallets in the environment.
"I'll hit you with everything I've got. Then I'll do it again." — Yui Kimura
 Yui
Appraisal

You have a careful eye that notices what many overlook.

Start the Trial with '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3 Tokens</span>''':
* When a Chest<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> has already been opened, consume '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1 Token</span>''' to rummage through it for an Item<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
* Rummage through Chests '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">40</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">80</span>''' '''&#37;''' faster.
<p>''Rummaging is only available once per Chest.''

You have a careful eye that notices what many overlook.

Start the Trial with 3 Tokens:

  • When a Chest has already been opened, consume 1 Token to rummage through it for an Item.
  • Rummage through Chests 40/60/80 % faster.

Rummaging is only available once per Chest.

 Élodie
Autodidact

You start the Trial with a Progression penalty of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">-25 %</span>''' for succeeding a Good Skill Check<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> while healing another Survivor<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
*Succeeding a Good Skill Check while healing another Survivor grants '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">1 Token</span>''', up to a maximum of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">4</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">5</span>''' '''Tokens'''.
*Each Token grants a stack-able Progression bonus of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">+15 %</span>''' for succeeding a Good Skill Check while healing another Survivor.
*'''Suppresses''' Great Skill Checks while healing another Survivor.

''Autodidact'' remains inactive while healing another Survivor using a [[Med-Kit]]<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

You start the Trial with a Progression penalty of -25 % for succeeding a Good Skill Check while healing another Survivor.
  • Succeeding a Good Skill Check while healing another Survivor grants 1 Token, up to a maximum of 3/4/5 Tokens.
  • Each Token grants a stack-able Progression bonus of +15 % for succeeding a Good Skill Check while healing another Survivor.
  • Suppresses Great Skill Checks while healing another Survivor.

Autodidact remains inactive while healing another Survivor using a Med-Kit.

"There's no limit to what you can achieve, as long as you back with hard work." — Adam Francis

 Adam
Background Player

You are not usually the centre of attention and in some cases, this can be a good thing.
<p>When another Survivor is picked up, ''Background Player'' activates for the next '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">10 seconds</span>''':
* When you start running, break into a sprint at '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">150 %</span>''' of your normal Running Movement speed for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">4 seconds</span>'''.
<p>''Background Player'' causes the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.
<p>''Background Player'' cannot be used when '''''Exhausted'''''.

You are not usually the centre of attention and in some cases, this can be a good thing.

When another Survivor is picked up, Background Player activates for the next 10 seconds:

  • When you start running, break into a sprint at 150 % of your normal Running Movement speed for 4 seconds.

Background Player causes the Exhausted Status Effect for 60/50/40 seconds.

Background Player cannot be used when Exhausted.

"You forget about me?" — Renato Lyra

 Renato
Balanced Landing

Your agility and cat-like relexes are incomparable.
<p>When falling from great heights, you benefit from the following effects:
* '''Reduces''' the Stagger duration by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">75 %</span>'''.
* '''Suppresses''' ''Grunts of Exertion'' from falling.
* Upon landing, break into a sprint at '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">150 %</span>''' of your normal Running Movement speed for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr8" style="color: #d41c1c;">3 seconds</span>'''.
<p>''Balanced Landing'' causes the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">40</span>''' '''seconds'''.

''Balanced Landing'' cannot be used when '''''Exhausted'''''.

Your agility and cat-like relexes are incomparable.

When falling from great heights, you benefit from the following effects:

  • Reduces the Stagger duration by 75 %.
  • Suppresses Grunts of Exertion from falling.
  • Upon landing, break into a sprint at 150 % of your normal Running Movement speed for 3 seconds.

Balanced Landing causes the Exhausted Status Effect for 60/50/40 seconds.
Balanced Landing cannot be used when Exhausted.

"I have jumped from higher places." — Nea Karlsson

 Nea
Better than New

You are an expert in combat medicine.

Patients leave your care reinvigorated.
<p>Upon completing a Healing action on another Survivor<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, they benefit from the following effect until the next time they take damage:
* '''Increases''' their Action speeds in Healing, Unlocking, Cleansing, and Blessing by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">12</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">14</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">16</span>''' '''&#37;'''.

You are an expert in combat medicine.

Patients leave your care reinvigorated.

Upon completing a Healing action on another Survivor, they benefit from the following effect until the next time they take damage:

  • Increases their Action speeds in Healing, Unlocking, Cleansing, and Blessing by 12/14/16 %.
 Rebecca
Bite the Bullet

Pain hurts you as much as anyone, but you would prefer others do not know that.

When healing yourself or another Survivor<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, ''Grunts of Pain'' and all noises related to the ''Healing action'' are suppressed:
*Failed Healing Skill Checks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> do not trigger a ''Loud Noise Notification'' and only apply a Regression penalty of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">2</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">1</span>''' '''&#37;'''.

Pain hurts you as much as anyone, but you would prefer others do not know that.

When healing yourself or another Survivor, Grunts of Pain and all noises related to the Healing action are suppressed:

  • Failed Healing Skill Checks do not trigger a Loud Noise Notification and only apply a Regression penalty of 3/2/1 %.
"I can do this." — Leon Scott Kennedy
 Leon
Blast Mine

When direct combat is not an option, you still find ways to strike back.
<p>After repairing Generators<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> for a total of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">50 %</span>''', ''Blast Mine'' activates:
*After continuing to repair any Generator for another '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">3 seconds</span>''', you can press the ''Active Ability button'' to install a Trap, which stays active for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">100</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">110</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">120</span>''' '''seconds'''.
*When the Killer<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> damages the ''Trapped Generator'', its Trap explodes, stunning them and blinding anyone nearby.

''Blast Mine'' deactivates after triggering successfully or once the timer runs out.
<p>The Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of ''Trapped Generators'' are revealed to all Survivors in '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">yellow</span>'''.

When direct combat is not an option, you still find ways to strike back.

After repairing Generators for a total of 50 %, Blast Mine activates:

  • After continuing to repair any Generator for another 3 seconds, you can press the Active Ability button to install a Trap, which stays active for 100/110/120 seconds.
  • When the Killer damages the Trapped Generator, its Trap explodes, stunning them and blinding anyone nearby.
Blast Mine deactivates after triggering successfully or once the timer runs out.

The Auras of Trapped Generators are revealed to all Survivors in yellow.

"You want S.T.A.R.S.? I'll give you S.T.A.R.S.!" — Jill Valentine

 Jill
Blood Pact

It is as if a latent part of yourself has awakened.

You feel like you can reach out beyond yourself for assistance.
<p>When either you or the '''''Obsession<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' become injured by any means, ''Blood Pact'' activates:
*Your Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are constantly revealed to one another.
**Completing a ''Healing Action'' on the '''''Obsession<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' or having them complete one on yourself, grants both of you a '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">5</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">6</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">7</span>''' '''&#37;''' '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect'''.
**This effect lasts for as long as you both remain within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">16 metres</span>''' of one another.
*''Blood Pact'' deactivates after leaving this radius.


<p>''Blood Pact'' is temporarily disabled if you yourself are the '''''Obsession<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>'''''.
<p>Reduces the Odds of becoming the initial '''''Obsession''''' of the Killer by '''-100 %'''.

''The Killer can only be '''obsessed''' with one Survivor at a time.''

It is as if a latent part of yourself has awakened.

You feel like you can reach out beyond yourself for assistance.

When either you or the Obsession become injured by any means, Blood Pact activates:

  • Your Auras are constantly revealed to one another.
    • Completing a Healing Action on the Obsession or having them complete one on yourself, grants both of you a 5/6/7 % Haste Status Effect.
    • This effect lasts for as long as you both remain within 16 metres of one another.
  • Blood Pact deactivates after leaving this radius.

Blood Pact is temporarily disabled if you yourself are the Obsession.

Reduces the Odds of becoming the initial Obsession of the Killer by -100 %.
The Killer can only be obsessed with one Survivor at a time.

 Cheryl
Blood Rush

Your mind and body are honed for great feats, allowing you to push through with extra effort when necessary.
<p>Once you are one Hook away from instant death, ''Blood Rush'' activates:
*Press the ''Active Ability button'' to lose a Health State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> and instantly recover from the '''''Exhausted<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect'''.
*Causes the '''''Broken<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect''' for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">28</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">24</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">20</span>''' '''seconds''', while you are automatically healing back to Healthy<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
*Cancels the healing effect upon taking damage.


<p>''Blood Rush'' is disabled for the remainder of the Trial after use.

Your mind and body are honed for great feats, allowing you to push through with extra effort when necessary.

Once you are one Hook away from instant death, Blood Rush activates:

  • Press the Active Ability button to lose a Health State and instantly recover from the Exhausted Status Effect.
  • Causes the Broken Status Effect for 28/24/20 seconds, while you are automatically healing back to Healthy.
  • Cancels the healing effect upon taking damage.

Blood Rush is disabled for the remainder of the Trial after use.

"Just gotta... push through!" — Renato Lyra

 Renato
Boil Over

You are a battler and do everything to escape a foe's grasp.
<p>While being carried by the Killer<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>, the following effects apply:
* '''Increases''' the intensity of the ''Struggle Effects'' on the Killer from your ''Wiggling'' by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">60</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">70</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">80</span>''' '''&#37;'''.
* '''Obscures''' the Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of all Hooks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> from the Killer's Aura-reading abilities within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">16 metres</span>'''.
* '''Fills''' your ''Wiggle Meter'' by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr6" style="color: #ff8800;">33 %</span>''' of your current Wiggle progression upon landing, when the Killer drops from great heights.

You are a battler and do everything to escape a foe's grasp.

While being carried by the Killer, the following effects apply:

  • Increases the intensity of the Struggle Effects on the Killer from your Wiggling by 60/70/80 %.
  • Obscures the Auras of all Hooks from the Killer's Aura-reading abilities within 16 metres.
  • Fills your Wiggle Meter by 33 % of your current Wiggle progression upon landing, when the Killer drops from great heights.

"Buck and Wild,
Swing to be free,
Your hands just can't keep ahold of me." — Kate Denson's "Boil Over"

 Kate
Bond

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:
* The Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> of all other Survivors<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 5px"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> within '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">20</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">28</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">36</span>''' '''metres''' of your location are revealed to you.

Unlocks potential in your Aura-reading ability:
  • The Auras of all other Survivors within 20/28/36 metres of your location are revealed to you.

"We have to work as a team, I need you to survive so that I can survive!" — Dwight Fairfield

 Dwight
Boon: Circle of Healing

A Boon that offers comfort amidst the terror.
<p>Press and hold the ''Active Ability button'' on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a '''''Boon Totem<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>'''''.

Soft chimes ring out in a radius of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">24 metres</span>'''.
<p>All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the ''Boon Totem's'' radius:
<p>
*'''Increases''' Altruistic Healing speeds by '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">50</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">75</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">100</span>''' '''&#37;''' when not using a [[Med-Kit]]<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.
*If a Survivor is injured, their Aura<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> will be revealed to all other Survivors.

Survivors can only be affected by one instance of ''Boon: Circle of Healing'' at a time.
<p>''Only one Totem can be blessed by your '''Boon Perks''' at a time and all of their effects are active on the same '''Boon Totem'''''.

A Boon that offers comfort amidst the terror.

Press and hold the Active Ability button on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a Boon Totem.
Soft chimes ring out in a radius of 24 metres.

All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the Boon Totem's radius:

  • Increases Altruistic Healing speeds by 50/75/100 % when not using a Med-Kit.
  • If a Survivor is injured, their Aura will be revealed to all other Survivors.
Survivors can only be affected by one instance of Boon: Circle of Healing at a time.

Only one Totem can be blessed by your Boon Perks at a time and all of their effects are active on the same Boon Totem.

"Try this, it is better than anything you'll find in a pharmacy." — Mikaela Reid

 Mikaela
Boon: Dark Theory

Your obsessive study of the paranormal has given you unprecedented knowledge of other Realms and planes of existence.

Press and hold the ''Active Ability button'' on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a '''''Boon Totem<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>'''''.

Soft chimes ring out in a radius of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">24 metres</span>'''.
<p>All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the ''Boon Totem's'' radius:
*'''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">2 %</span>''' '''''Haste<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>''''' '''Status Effect'''.
*This effect lingers for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">2</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">4</span>''' '''seconds''' after leaving the ''Boon Totem's'' range.

''Only one Totem can be blessed by your '''Boon Perks''' at a time and all of their effects are active on the same '''Boon Totem'''''.

Your obsessive study of the paranormal has given you unprecedented knowledge of other Realms and planes of existence.

Press and hold the Active Ability button on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a Boon Totem.
Soft chimes ring out in a radius of 24 metres.

All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the Boon Totem's radius:

  • 2 % Haste Status Effect.
  • This effect lingers for 2/3/4 seconds after leaving the Boon Totem's range.
Only one Totem can be blessed by your Boon Perks at a time and all of their effects are active on the same Boon Totem.
 Yoichi
Boon: Exponential

When it seems like your number is up, you consider ways to recalculate the odds.

Press and hold the ''Active Ability button'' on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a '''''Boon Totem<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>'''''.

Soft chimes ring out in a radius of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">24 metres</span>'''.
<p>All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the ''Boon Totem's'' radius:
*'''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">90</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">95</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">100</span>''' '''&#37;''' bonus to the Recovery speed.
*Unlocks the ''Self-Recovery'' ability, allowing you to fully recover from the Dying State<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>.

''Only one Totem can be blessed by your '''Boon Perks''' at a time and all of their effects are active on the same '''Boon Totem'''''.

When it seems like your number is up, you consider ways to recalculate the odds.

Press and hold the Active Ability button on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a Boon Totem.
Soft chimes ring out in a radius of 24 metres.

All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the Boon Totem's radius:

  • 90/95/100 % bonus to the Recovery speed.
  • Unlocks the Self-Recovery ability, allowing you to fully recover from the Dying State.
Only one Totem can be blessed by your Boon Perks at a time and all of their effects are active on the same Boon Totem.

"It is not our time to die... probably." — Jonah Vasquez

 Jonah
Boon: Shadow Step

A Boon that conceals the truth.

Press and hold the ''Active Ability button'' on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a '''''Boon Totem<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span>'''''.

Soft chimes ring out in a radius of '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">24 metres</span>'''.
<p>All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the ''Boon Totem's'' radius:
*Scratch Marks<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are suppressed.
*Auras<span style = "padding: 0 0 0 0"><span style = "display:none" class = "pcView"><span class = "tooltip linkIncluded iconless borderless"><span class="tooltipBaseText"></span><span class = "tooltiptext"><span class="tooltipTextWrapper"></span></span></span></span><span class = "mobileView"></span></span> are hidden from The Killer.
**Both effects linger for '''<span class="luaClr clr clr2" style="color: #e8c252;">2</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr3" style="color: #199b1e;">3</span>'''/'''<span class="luaClr clr clr4" style="color: #ac3ee3;">4</span>''' '''seconds''' after leaving the ''Boon Totem's'' range.

''Only one Totem can be blessed by your '''Boon Perks''' at a time and all of their effects are active on the same '''Boon Totem'''''.

A Boon that conceals the truth.

Press and hold the Active Ability button on a Dull or Hex Totem to bless it and create a Boon Totem.
Soft chimes ring out in a radius of 24 metres.

All Survivors benefit from the following effects when inside the Boon Totem's radius:

  • Scratch Marks are suppressed.
  • Auras are hidden from The Killer.
    • Both effects linger for 2/3/4 seconds after leaving the Boon Totem's range.
Only one Totem can be blessed by your Boon Perks at a time and all of their effects are active on the same Boon Totem.

"Stick to the shadows and cover your tracks." — Mikaela Reid
